niagara.ndom
Interface DOMParser

All Known Implementing Classes:
SAXDOMParser, XercesJ2Parser, XercesJParser, XML4JParser
public interface DOMParser

DOMParser is the interface implemented by all Niagara DOM implementations.

Method Summary

Method Detail

parse

void parse(org.xml.sax.InputSource inputSource)
           throws org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                  java.io.IOException
parse parses an XML document and produces a DOM tree (that can be retrieved by getDocument()

Parameters:
inputSource - an InputSource value
Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException - if a parsing error occurs
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

getDocument

org.w3c.dom.Document getDocument()
If parsing was successful getDocument returns the DOM Document node.

Returns:
a Document value

hasErrors

boolean hasErrors()
hasErrors

Returns:
true if any errors occured during parsing

getErrorStrings

java.lang.String getErrorStrings()
Returns:
the error messages accumulated so far, if possible

getWarningStrings

java.lang.String getWarningStrings()
Returns:
the warning messages accumulated so far, if possible

hasWarnings

boolean hasWarnings()
hasWarnings

Returns:
true if any warnings occured during parsing

supportsStreaming

boolean supportsStreaming()
Indicates if the implementation supports streaming of documents. That is if the implementation can parse a stream of documents from one input source, or if we need to provide a new input source for each call to parse.
